title: AWS CloudWatch to Azure Monitor: System Monitoring, Logging, and Automated Remediation
certificationWeight: 20% - Monitoring, Logging, and Remediation Domain (Largest Weight)
description: Master comprehensive system monitoring by implementing AWS CloudWatch monitoring and migrating to Azure Monitor equivalents with automated logging, alerting, remediation workflows, and operational intelligence across both platforms.
learningObjectives: Implement comprehensive monitoring with AWS CloudWatch and Azure Monitor
Design centralized logging strategies using CloudWatch Logs and Azure Log Analytics
Build automated alerting and notification systems across both platforms
Create automated remediation workflows for common operational issues
Implement operational dashboards and reporting for infrastructure health
Design incident response and escalation procedures with automation
prerequisites: Completion of DVA-C02 certification labs or equivalent development experience
Basic knowledge of scripting (PowerShell, Python, or Bash)
Familiarity with infrastructure components and system administration
businessScenario: OpsTech Solutions manages a complex multi-tier application infrastructure supporting 24/7 operations for critical business services. They need to implement comprehensive monitoring, centralized logging, proactive alerting, and automated remediation to ensure high availability and rapid incident response. The operations team must master both AWS and Azure monitoring ecosystems to support hybrid cloud deployments and potential platform migrations while maintaining operational excellence.

troubleshooting.issue: Alert fatigue due to excessive or irrelevant notifications
troubleshooting.solution: Implement alert correlation and suppression, use statistical anomaly detection, create tiered alerting based on severity, and regularly tune alert thresholds based on historical data

troubleshooting.issue: High monitoring and logging costs with large data volumes
troubleshooting.solution: Implement intelligent data sampling, use appropriate retention policies, optimize log structure, implement cost-aware alerting, and use compression and archival strategies

troubleshooting.issue: Automated remediation causing unintended side effects or cascading failures
troubleshooting.solution: Implement safety controls and circuit breakers, use gradual rollout for automation changes, implement comprehensive testing, and maintain manual override capabilities
